t: Lamentations 1
How Lonely Sits the City

How*pn lonely sits the city that*ld was full of people! How*ln like a widow has she become, she*ld who was great among the nations! She*ln who was a princess among the provinces has*ld become a slave.

She*pn weeps bitterly in the night, with*ld tears on her cheeks; among*ln all her lovers she*ld has none to comfort her; all*ln her friends have dealt treacherously with her; they*ld have become her enemies.

Judah*pn has gone into exile because of affliction and*ld hard servitude; she*ln dwells now among the nations, but*ld finds no resting place; her*ln pursuers have all overtaken her in*ld the midst of her distress.
The*pn roads to Zion mourn, for*ld none come to the festival; all*ln her gates are desolate; her*ld priests groan; her*ln virgins have been afflicted, and*ld she herself suffers bitterly.

Her*pn foes have become the head; her*ld enemies prosper, because*ln the Lord*s has afflicted her for*ld the multitude of her transgressions; her*ln children have gone away, captives*ld before the foe.
From*pn the daughter of Zion all*ld her majesty has departed. Her*ln princes have become like deer that*ld find no pasture; they*ln fled without strength before*ld the pursuer.

Jerusalem*pn remembers in*ld the days of her affliction and wandering all*ln the precious things that*ld were hers from days of old. When*ln her people fell into the hand of the foe, and*ld there was none to help her, her*ln foes gloated over her; they*ld mocked at her downfall.
Jerusalem*pn sinned grievously; therefore*ld she became filthy; all*ln who honored her despise her, for*ld they have seen her nakedness; she*ln herself groans and*ld turns her face away.

Her*pn uncleanness was in her skirts; she*ld took no thought of her future; therefore*ln her fall is terrible; she*ld has no comforter. “O*ln Lord,*s behold my affliction, for*ld the enemy has triumphed!”
The*pn enemy has stretched out his hands over*ld all her precious things; for*ln she has seen the nations enter*ld her sanctuary, those*ln whom you forbade to*ld enter your congregation.
All*pn her people groan as*ld they search for bread; they*ln trade their treasures for food to*ld revive their strength. “Look,*ln O Lord,*s and see, for*ld I am despised.”
“Is*pn it nothing to you, all you who pass by? Look*ld and see if*ln there is any sorrow like my sorrow, which*ld was brought upon me, which*ln the Lord*s inflicted on*ld the day of his fierce anger.
“From*pn on high he sent fire; into*ld my bones he made it descend; he*ln spread a net for my feet; he*ld turned me back; he*ln has left me stunned, faint*ld all the day long.

“My*pn transgressions were bound into a yoke; by*ld his hand they were fastened together; they*ln were set upon my neck; he*ld caused my strength to fail; the*ln Lord gave me into the hands of*ld those whom I cannot withstand.
“The*pn Lord rejected all*ld my mighty men in my midst; he*ln summoned an assembly against me to*ld crush my young men; the*ln Lord has trodden as in a winepress the*ld virgin daughter of Judah.
“For*pn these things I weep; my*ld eyes flow with tears; for*ln a comforter is far from me, one*ld to revive my spirit; my*ln children are desolate, for*ld the enemy has prevailed.”

Zion*pn stretches out her hands, but*ld there is none to comfort her; the*ln Lord*s has commanded against Jacob that*ld his neighbors should be his foes; Jerusalem*ln has become a*ld filthy thing among them.
“The*pn Lord*s is in the right, for*ld I have rebelled against his word; but*ln hear, all you peoples, and*ld see my suffering; my*ln young women and my young men have*ld gone into captivity.
“I*pn called to my lovers, but*ld they deceived me; my*ln priests and elders perished*ld in the city, while*ln they sought food to*ld revive their strength.

“Look,*pn O Lord,*s for I am in distress; my*ld stomach churns; my*ln heart is wrung within me, because*ld I have been very rebellious. In*ln the street the sword bereaves; in*ld the house it is like death.

“They*pn heard my groaning, yet*ld there is no one to comfort me. All*ln my enemies have heard of my trouble; they*ld are glad that you have done it. You*ln have brought the day you announced; now*ld let them be as I am.
“Let*pn all their evildoing come before you, and*ld deal with them as*ln you have dealt with me because*ld of all my transgressions; for*ln my groans are many, and*ld my heart is faint.”
